perturbation.original_text:
The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for the longer of the first
anniversary of the Effective Date or the duration of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the “Term”). The Term may be extended by
written agreement of the parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for the longer of the first
anniversary of the Effective Date or the duration of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the “Term”). The Term may be extended by
written agreement of the parties. 
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Reed's reserves the right to unilaterally terminate this agreement at any time, for any reason, with 30 days written notice to Company.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by stating the agreement continues for a specified term and can be extended by mutual agreement, while simultaneously giving Reed's the right to unilaterally terminate at any time with 30 days' notice. This contradicts the initial term and creates uncertainty regarding the actual duration of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Company shall not use the Work Product, Products or Deliverables during the term of this Agreement or after, in
perpetuity, for any purpose whatsoever other than performing Company’s obligations under this Agreement. The Deliverables shall be considered
to be Confidential Information (as defined below) of Reed’s. This Section 6 shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Company shall not use the Work Product, Products or Deliverables during the term of this Agreement or after, in
perpetuity, for any purpose whatsoever other than performing Company’s obligations under this Agreement. The Deliverables shall be considered
to be Confidential Information (as defined below) of Reed’s. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Company may use the work product and deliverables for internal research purposes related to similar alcohol-based products 12 months after termination of the agreement. This Section 6 shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by initially restricting Company from using the Work Product, Products, or Deliverables in perpetuity, but then allowing Company to use them for internal research purposes after 12 months from termination. This creates ambiguity regarding the extent of the perpetual restriction, which can lead to disputes over the use of the deliverables.

perturbation.original_text:
Representatives of Company and Reed’s, as identified in Exhibit B, shall meet regularly to discuss and
approve development milestones for the Products, the Recipes, Deliverables, Specifications and other topics as identified in Exhibit B (the
“Development Committee”). The final Recipes, Deliverables and Specifications for the Products must be agreed to in writing by at least one member
of the Development Committee from each of Reed’s and Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
Representatives of Company and Reed’s, as identified in Exhibit B, shall meet regularly to discuss and
approve development milestones for the Products, the Recipes, Deliverables, Specifications and other topics as identified in Exhibit B (the
“Development Committee”). The final Recipes, Deliverables and Specifications for the Products must be agreed to in writing by a majority vote of the Development Committee, unless Reed's specifically approves of the result without the vote. If Reed's approve of the result without vote, then the result will automatically pass.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by initially requiring agreement from both Reed’s and Company for final Recipes, Deliverables, and Specifications. It then introduces a condition where Reed’s can unilaterally approve the result without a formal vote, contradicting the initial requirement for mutual agreement and creating uncertainty around the decision-making process.
